lead_paragraph: Sajmir Alimehmeti tried on multiple occasions to travel to Syria to fight for the Islamic State, according to law enforcement officials, who built a case against him over 18 months.

byline.contributor: Emily Palmer and Remy Tumin contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and BENJAMIN WEISER

headline.print_headline: Charges That Bronx Man Tried to Join ISIS Show Shift in Terror Cases
headline.main: Bronx Man Accused of Trying to Join ISIS Is Arrested

snippet: Sajmir Alimehmeti tried on multiple occasions to travel to Syria to fight for the Islamic State, according to law enforcement officials, who built a case against him over 18 months.
abstract: Sajmir Alimehmeti of Bronx is arrested on charges of providing material support to a terrorist organization and passport fraud after trying to help undercover cop posing as aspiring Islamic State conspirator; case points to shift in focus away from those trying to go overseas to fight for group and toward those posing threat at home.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
